title: Does upgrading windows 7 from 32-bit to 64-bit erases data? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! You cannot upgrade from 32bit to 64bit windows. You have to do a clean install i.e. You will have to format the C: drive of your system and as you know formatting erases data. I suggest you to take a backup of your C: drive and perform the installation. Kindly rename your C: drive to OS so that you do not accidently format other drives during installation process. If you have 4GB or more RAM then it is advisable to install a 64 bit Windows.

Yes. If you clean install Windows 7 64-bit on top of your existing 32-installation, then your applications and settings are wiped. Any data is moved to Windows.old. So backup before upgrading to 64-bit
